name: ampliseq-its-fungal
title: ITS Fungal Community Profiling (nf-core/ampliseq)
description: Characterize fungal communities from ITS amplicon sequencing data using the nf-core/ampliseq pipeline. Performs quality control, ASV inference with DADA2, taxonomic classification using UNITE database, and generates comprehensive diversity metrics for mycobiome research and plant pathology studies.
content:
ITS Fungal Community Profiling

The nf-core/ampliseq pipeline analyzes ITS (Internal Transcribed Spacer) amplicon sequencing data to characterize fungal communities. This Camber app is pre-configured with ITS2 region primers and the UNITE taxonomic database for robust fungal identification in mycobiome and plant pathology research.

What This Pipeline Does

  • Quality Control: Assess read quality with FastQC
  • Primer Trimming: Remove primers using Cutadapt
  • ASV Inference: Generate Amplicon Sequence Variants with DADA2, optimized for ITS length variability
  • Taxonomic Classification: Assign taxonomy using UNITE database for fungi
  • Diversity Analysis: Calculate alpha and beta diversity metrics
  • Visualization: Generate interactive reports and taxonomic plots

Input Requirements

Provide a CSV samplesheet with the following columns:

  • sampleID: Unique sample identifier
  • forwardReads: Path/URL to R1 FASTQ file
  • reverseReads: Path/URL to R2 FASTQ file
  • run: (Optional) Sequencing run identifier

Key Outputs

  • ASV Table: dada2/ASV_table.tsv - Fungal ASV counts per sample
  • Taxonomy: dada2/ASV_tax.tsv - UNITE taxonomic assignments
  • Diversity Metrics: qiime2/diversity/ - Alpha/beta diversity analysis
  • QC Report: multiqc/multiqc_report.html - Comprehensive quality control

Biological Context

This pipeline targets the ITS2 region of the fungal ribosomal RNA gene complex, the standard marker for fungal identification. The ITS region shows high variability in length between different fungal taxa, requiring special handling with the --illumina_pe_its flag for optimal paired-end read merging.

Use Cases:

  • Mycobiome Research: Characterize fungal communities in environmental samples
  • Plant Pathology: Identify fungal pathogens in plant tissues
  • Agricultural Studies: Assess soil fungal diversity and plant-fungal interactions
  • Clinical Mycology: Profile fungal populations in clinical samples

Note: Primers are hardcoded for the ITS2 region (GTGARTCATCGAATCTTTG / TCCTCCGCTTATTGATATGC). UNITE database is automatically downloaded during pipeline execution. The --illumina_pe_its flag ensures proper handling of ITS length variability.
